column16: Description of Program
column18: Ave. # of hours of all digital programming per week
column19: Ave. # of hours per week of digital Core Programming per week
column20: Y or N to Q 11 in Digital Core Programming: At least 50% of the Core Programming had not already aired within the previous seven days

column16: In the personae of a group of dalmatian puppies and their friend, a resourceful chicken named "Spot," this series addresses many of the key developmental issues of middle childhood. Stories revolve around conflicts over rules, learning to be responsible, attempts to gain peer acceptance, learning from mistakes, desires to help other animals or human characters, problem-solving. The series encourages prosocial values such as empathy, fairness, and cooperative behavior as well as modeling information-gathering and thinking strategies.

This series features long-form educational elements -- "Brand Spanking New! Doug," "Disney's Recess" and "Disney's Pepper Ann" -- and short-form educational elements. This two-hour program block features three half-hour educational series in combination with a variety of short-form educational and entertainment elements which include "Great Minds...Think For Themselves" (American History segments), ABC's Schoolhouse Rock" and fact-based shorts called "What's Up With That?". Brand Spanking New! Doug -- Narrated via the spoken journal entries of aspiring writer/cartoonist Doug Funnie, this series uses humor and fantasy in depicting the struggles of a twelve-year-old boy to develop self-confidence and identity, resolve family, peer and school problems and maintain friendships strained by preadolescent physical and emotional change. Series episodes foster values such as honesty, loyalty, fairness and respect for individual differences. By means of its narrative episode structure "Brand Spanking New! Doug" also serves to encourage creative writing and artistic expression. (Target Age - 8-12) Disney's Pepper Ann -- "Pepper Ann" features a twelve-year-old girl who demonstrates that individuality, self-expression, competence and humor are assets for a pre-teenager. From week to week Pepper, who is growing up in a single-parent family and who attends Middle School, learns that it is O.K. to make mistakes and that it is important to speak out for what one believes. Additionally, the series affirms positive values such as effort/perseverance, taking responsibility, creativity and the value of friendship. (Target Age - 10-12) Disney's Recess -- "Disney's Recess" is a collection of animated stories about a group of fourth graders who attend suburban public school. Having been loyal friends for years, these children are an ethnically and gender-diverse group. They provide role models for viewers who may likewise be struggling with problems common to middle childhood such as conflicts with authority figures, school and family rules, desire to be popular, peer pressure, crises of confidence, lack of fairness. A recurrent theme is the issue of dealing with the class bully or "teacher's pet." Certain episodes raise thought-provoking questions which parents and children can talk about together, providing a rich source of value-oriented family discussion material. (Target Age - 8-12)

The 1997-98 episodes of "Jungle Cubs" are specifically designed to be an educational children's series. In this animated series the beloved animals from Rudyard Kipling's "The Jungle Book" -- Bagheera, Baloo, Hathi, Kaa, Louie and Shere Khan -- are portrayed as young animals who are growing up in the jungles of India. Series episodes teach and reinforce prosocial values such as cooperative behavior, resolving disagreements, developing empathy, building self-esteem, taking responsibility, overcoming fears, maintaining friendships.

column7: THE NEW ADVENTURES OF WINNIE THE POOH
column16: Based on the classic "Winnie The Pooh" book series by author A.A. Milne, "The New Adventures of Winnie The Pooh" depicts the everyday lives of Christopher Robin and his animal companions Pooh, Piglet, Rabbit, Tigger, Eeyore, Owl and Gopher. Series episodes convey strong prosocial messages about honesty, taking responsibility, persistence, cooperative effort, friendship and caring. Episodes are designed to have great educational relevance to younger viewers and to help younger children distinguish between fantasy and reality, identify feelings and overcome common childhood fears.

"Science Court" offers a novel and highly entertaining approach to science education. Primarily designed for children in the middle school grades, the series uses a humorous courtroom setting as a vehicle for teaching broad scientific concepts and their everyday applications. In the courtroom setting characters present their views in a logical manner, enabling the home viewing audience to develop logical and sequential thinking skills, to examine and discribe phenomena, to evaluate hypotheses in light of data obtained and to use both inductive and deductive reasoning. Key science concepts are illustrated by means of courtroom "demonstrations" and graphics.

This short-form educational program teaches concepts in grammar, math, U.S. history, science and finance by transforming these concepts into popular song, rhyme and amusing visuals. This method of presenting academic concepts has proven to be a powerful instructional tool.

This short-form educational program teaches concepts in grammar, math, U.S. history, science and finance by transforming these concepts into popular song, rhyme and amusing visuals. This method of presenting academic concepts has proven to be a powerful instructional tool.

column7: BRAND SPANKING NEW DOUG HOLIDAY MARATHON
column16: This special features four episodes of "Brand Spanking New Doug." Narrated via entries in Doug's journal, the special follows Doug through some unique learning experiences -- parental advice, appreciation, standing up for what you believe in, and feeling left out -- culminating with the arrival of a new baby sibling.

Based on the novel "The Secret Garden" by Frances Hodgson Burnett, this animated special recounts the story of Mary Lennox, a child orphaned in a late 1800's smallpox epidemic in India. The child was brought to England to live with her uncle.
This show takes kids on field trips to all kinds of fun, exciting and educational places all over L.A.

This program features Jack Hanna's worldly adventures to the remote jungles, rain forests, sea coasts and parks where kids meet new friends and learn about the importance of animals to our ecological system.
This program introduces kids to topical newsworthy information and features a variety of stories and people which helps open kids up to learn more about the world around them.

This program explores the mysteries of wild and domestic animals, introducing kids to animals of all kinds where they get to learn about their instincts, behaviors and natural habitats. Also the show regularly offers pet tips.

column7: BELLE'S BOOKSHOP: SING ME A STORY
column16: This live action Belle teaches children significan lessons of life through readings and songs. In each half-hour episode, Belle invites kids into her enchanted Book and Music Shop to retell classic Disney fables. And with the help of puppets, story telling, song and dances, Belle teaches children valuable lessons of life.

column7: DISNEY PRESENTS BILL NYE THE SCIENCE GUY
column16: "BILL NYE THE SCIENCE GUY" - Science Guy Bill Nye entertains and engages children while teaching fairly sophisticated scientific concepts. Program segments include lab experiments, video field trips and informative visits with television stars and Vice President Al Gore. Recent episodes have focused on the difference between human and animal communication, the human brain, mammals, rivers and streams, computers and nutrition.
"Popular Mechanics For Kids" - gives young viewers a first-hand look at how things are built and operated. The "How Team" reporters go to work sites where the experts provide hands-on demonstrations.

"FIELD TRIP" - This program takes a look at history, art, music and science from a different angle "up close and personal". Children go on exciting, fun-filled real life adventures. "Field Trip" encourages independent exploration with suggested reading and resources for other information.

"PEER PRESSURE" - This is a game show which incorporates social and cultural issues facing today's teens and teaches them how to make the right decisions. The program provides teens a better understanding of the factors that influence the choices that they make and helps them make educated choices that will further their social and emotional development.

"CLICK" - Click is a teen oriented educational game show. It teaches teens the importance of team work and incorporates questions from the world of entertainment and sports, as well as questions in math, science, literature, history, and current events.

In this series, the scientist host, Beakman, responds to viewer's questions about a variety of scientific phenomena by performing experiments and demonstrations. The objectives of the program are to increase early school age children's knowledge of selected scientific facts and principles, to stimulate their curiosity about the world around them, and to teach them to understand and use scientific techniques and methods to learn about the world. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

In this series, three young sleuths join forces to solve mysteries. Reading, writing and problem-solving skills all come into play, as the children's other-worldly ally, "Ghostwriter," provides them with written answers to their questions, thereby helping them to solve each mystery. The objective of the program is to provide compelling opportunities for school-age children to read and write, thereby motivating them to enjoy and value these skills. The program also seeks to show children how to use effective reading and writing strategies. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

In this program, children compete to solve word and language puzzles that are based on age-appropriate educational material similar to that found in the traditional school curriculum. The objectives of the program are to demonstrate to viewers techniques of defining a problem and judging information, and to teach them how principles of critical thinking can be applied to solve the puzzles. The program also aims to teach children information and facts about science, mathematics, history, language, the arts music and sports through the program's games and activities. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

column7: THE SPORTS ILLUSTRATED FOR KIDS SHOW
column16: In this series, two young hosts go behind the scenes to interview successful athletes and provide information about their lives both on and off the field. The program also provides information about health, fitness and nutrition, and presents the views of children on a variety of issues of public significance. The program seeks to help children understand the level of training, discipline, perseverence and practice it takes to be a successful athlete, so that they can incorporate some level of these traits in their own lives. It also aims to encourage children to participate in physical activities as an individual and/or team member, in both competitive and non-competitive settings, and to teach them the importance of maintaining good health and nutritional practices. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

In this program, the host, Al Yankovic, brings his distinctive personality and humor to bear on various situations and interactions with others, in order to convey to children messages relating to honesty, self-expression, personal responsibility, cooperation, respect for oneself and others, and other issues critical to social development. The program aims to help viewers appreciate the uniqueness of each individual and the strengths inherent in a diverse society, and to foster children's pro-social development. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

Based on the book series by award-winning author Judy Blume, the program follows its soon-to-be-teen protagonist as he deals with the trials and tribulations into which he is led by his little brother Fudge. The program focuses on issues young children need to understand in order to move successfully toward the next stage of social-emotional development. Its objectives are to help young viewers, through story-telling and program content, to learn about and put into practice some of the basic techniques associated with conflict resolution, and makes them aware of some of the ways to mediate and resolve conflict using prosocial behaviors. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

column7: THE CRAYOLA KIDS ADVENTURES- GULLIVER'S TRAVELS
column16: This live-action series features adaptations of literary classics, tailored specifically for children age 6 and older. The time-honored stories feature child actors in all roles. The objective of the series is to stimulate interest in reading and in classic literature.

This short form program consists of a series of one-minute vignettes highlighting current events. The objectives of the program are to inform children about important events taking place at local, state, and national levels and around the world, and to stimulate and foster their interest in seeking information about current events through various print and electronic media. The vignettes air on a weekly basis within each of the following core educational and informational programs - Beakman's world, Fudge, The Ghostwriter Mysteries, and The Weird Al Show.

column7: THE SPORTS ILLUSTRATED FOR KIDS SHOW
column16: In this series, two young hosts go behind the scenes to interview successful athletes and provide information about their lives both on and off the field. The program also provides information about health, fitness and nutrition, and presents the views of children on a variety of issues of public significance. The program seeks to help children understand the level of training, discipline, perseverence and practice it takes to be a successful athlete, so that they can incorporate some level of these traits in their own lives. It also aims to encourage children to participate in physical activities as an individual and/or team member, in both competitive and non-competitive settings, and to teach them the importance of maintaining good health and nutritional practices. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

"BANANAS IN PAJAMAS" - This live action series features mischievous twins who live in a colorful storybook world with their friends, the teddies, and the lovable rogue Rat-in-the-Hat. Together they engage in wondrous adventures that capture the imagination of children. These endearing stories teach young children about social concepts such as sharing, generousity, cooperation, following directions, and creative expression.

"THE ALL NEW CAPTAIN KANGAROO" - The program is built on the underlying premise that the growing intelligence of the young child is unique and fundamentally different from school-aged children. Major goals are to help develop a sense of self-esteem, exhibit a positive attitude toward life, demonstrate cooperation and pro-social behavior.
"ALGO'S FACTORY" - This educational program is designed to instill in children an interest in science, math and technology. This FCC friendly show will motivate kids and spark their imaginations.

"THE FROOZLES" - This program is entertaining, enlightening and educational, which expends the cognitive and intellectual powers of the children and demonstrates how to use these principles for the well being of their emotional and social life.
"TEEN TALK" - Teens and pre-teens share real life experiences and lessons they have learned with a licensed counselor/therapist.

"BOOKMICE" - Three fun-loving mice, live secretly behind the walls of the neighborhood library. Humor, wonder, stories, music and delightful animation are present in the everyday adventures of the mice, as they explore the wondrous world of books and the library's many friends and activities. Along with encouraging love of reading, these programs promote social values, as children learn about helping others, the importance of honesty and overcoming fears.

"NEW ZOO REVUE" - This show brings an understanding of the good and bad in life to children by teaching a way of life through music. The show has three costumed characters and features two human stars who guide children through situations they will encounter day to day with the use of music, song and dance.
A program that aims to educate adults and children alike on the growing population of stray animals and the importance of pet care.

"BILL NYE THE SCIENCE GUY" - Science Guy Bill Nye entertains and engages children while teaching fairly sophisticated scientific concepts. Episodes have focused on the difference between human and animal communication, the human brain, mammals, rivers and streams, computers and nutrition. The show includes experiments kids can do at home that reinforce concepts taught on the program.

"NEW ZOO REVUE" - This show brings an understanding of the good and bad in life to children by teaching a way of life through music. The show has three costumed characters and features two human stars who guide children through situations they will encounter day to day with the use of music, song and dance.

"BOOKMICE" - Three fun-loving mice, live secretly behind the walls of the neighborhood library. Humor, wonder, stories, music and delightful animation are present in the everyday adventures of the mice, as they explore the wondrous world of books and the library's many friends and activities. Along with encouraging love of reading, these programs promote social values, as children learn about helping others, the importance of honesty and overcoming fears.

column7: SING ME A STORY WITH BELLE
column16: "DISNEY'S SING A STORY WITH BELLE" - The series is designed to teach young children, through a series of classic stories and discussions, about fundamentals, morals and educational lessons of life. The show adresses issues like overcoming fears, working with others, understanding diversity, dealing with problems, etc. Reading is strongly encouraged throughout the series.
"NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC" - This program features travels to other countries and regions, ancient discoveries, plants, and animals, for pre-school, elementary, junior-high and high school aged children.
This educational magazine show for children features guest hosts who introduce studio, puppet and animated segments. Human relations, language skills and science are taught.

"NEW ZOO REVUE" - This show brings an understanding of the good and bad in life to children by teaching a way of life through music. The show has three costumed characters and features two human stars who guide children through situations they will encounter day to day with the use of music, song and dance.

"BOOKMICE" - Three fun-loving mice, live secretly behind the walls of the neighborhood library. Humor, wonder, stories, music and delightful animation are present in the everyday adventures of the mice, as they explore the wondrous world of books and the library's many friends and activities. Along with encouraging love of reading, these programs promote social values, as children learn about helping others, the importance of honesty and overcoming fears.

This Telly award-winning educational and informational program for children features singer storyteller Jack Houston and the characters who live on his farm. Through live action and puppetry, Mr. Houston and his animal friends deal with a wide spectrum of life experiences. Children learn valuable life lessons, from the importance of reading to the importance of friends and everything between.

This award-winning educational series is designed to foster music appreciation in youngsters. The primary focus of each program is to impart knowledge about a particular musical instrument or style of music.

"YOUNG AMERICA OUTDOORS" - Young America Outdoors educates and informs children about the various outdoor activities they can enjoy. It covers environmental issues, and teaches kids about the outdoors and its habitats. Young America Outdoors exposes children to useful information on activities they can participate in to further expand and enhance their knowledge.

"Sesamo" - provides reading readiness training, early mathematics skills, education in health, hygiene and nutrition, and provides encouragement and stimulation for academic success. Produced by CTW specifically for a Spanish-language audience.

"Giorgiomania" - a program organized around a combination of live-action and animated educational segments which are designed to teach children about different cultures, historical personalities, science, animals, and the environment.

column7: SAVED BY THE BELL: THE NEW CLASS (1)
column16: The educational objective of this program is to demonstrate how the knowledge of one or more characters in the story moves from one level to a more informed or higher level of knowledge by the end of each episode. This change in knowledge conveys an educational message to the audience which may fall into one or more categories - intellectual-cognitive and/or socio-emotional. The message will always be integral to the plot and present throughout the script. This objective is achieved through this series by exploring social themes through the daily school life of six teenage friends at Bayside High who help each other make the most of growing up in a complicated world. The Bayside kids give teens a useful perspective on many of the tough issues they have to face both in their peer relationships, and in personal decision-making both in and out of the classroom.

column7: SAVED BY THE BELL: THE NEW CLASS (2)
column16: The educational objective of this program is to demonstrate how the knowledge of one or more characters in the story moves from one level to a more informed or higher level of knowledge by the end of each episode. This change in knowledge conveys an educational message to the audience which may fall into one or more categories - intellectual-cognitive and/or socio-emotional. The message will always be integral to the plot and present throughout the script. This objective is achieved through this series by exploring social themes through the daily school life of six teenage friends at Bayside High who help each other make the most of growing up in a complicated world. The Bayside kids give teens a useful perspective on many of the tough issues they have to face both in their peer relationships, and in personal decision-making both in and out of the classroom.

The educational objective of this program is to demonstrate how the knowledge of one or more characters in the story moves from one level to a more informed or higher level of knowledge by the end of each episode. This change in knowledge conveys an educational message to the audience which may fall into one or more categories - intellectual-cognitive and/or socio-emotional. The message will always be integral to the plot and present throughout the script. This objective is achieved in this series by examining how a boy's team accepts a female player, and by exploring themes related to group processes, such as teamwork, reciprocity, cooperation and competition, tolerance and acceptance. As the team and their close friends go through each basketball season, they face new challenges and solve problems through individual effort and mutual support.

The educational objective of this program is to demonstrate how the knowledge of one or more characters in the story moves from one level to a more informed or higher level of knowledge by the end of each episode. This change in knowledge conveys an educational message to the audience which may fall into one or more categories - intellectual-cognitive and/or socio-emotional. The message will always be integral to the plot and present throughout the script. This objective is achieved in this series by examining how a boy's team accepts a female player, and by exploring themes related to group processes, such as teamwork, reciprocity, cooperation and competition, tolerance and acceptance. As the team and their close friends go through each basketball season, they face new challenges and solve problems through individual effort and mutual support.

The educational objective of this program is to introduce the teen audience to the pro-social, off-court activities of basketball players and other individuals, and to individuals who have overcome various obstacles in order to achieve their goals. The program segments are based on a curriculum inspired by the U.S. Department of Education's Goals 2000, with particular focus on messages encouraging the following values: school completion, community service, cooperation, tolerance of differences,healthful practices and athletics, peaceful conflict resolutions and global awareness. These educational and informational messages are conveyed primarily through real life examples, interviews and commentary by the program's hosts.

The educational objective of this program is to demonstrate how the knowledge of one or more characters in the story moves from one level to a more informed or higher level of knowledge by the end of each episode. This change in knowledge conveys an educational message to the audience which may fall into one or more categories - intellectual-cognitive and/or socio-emotional. The message will always be integral to the plot and present throughout the script. This objective is achieved in this series by exploring the pressures of living in a big city environment where situations are sometimes so difficult and challenging, kids have to learn sophisticated and responsible decision-making to be safe and stay focused. The series follows the encounters and problem-solving of two young men through an eventful school year at Manhattan High and shows teens how to work with their principal, family and friends to be successful.

This program is educational and intended to inform children 16 years of age and under. Different values in our daily life and how they are applied are discussed in this series. Subjects such as respect not only for people but for the environment are reviewed.

column7: STORIES OF CHINESE IDIOMS- CHINESE LANGUAGE
column16: This program is educational and intended to inform children 16 years of age and under. This series is designed to tell stories of Chinese idioms and how they began. It also explains their actual meaning and teaches children how to apply them to their daily lives.

This program is educational and intended to inform children 16 years of age and under. This series instructs children on a variety of subjects such as proper manners, science, and the English language using games, drama and cartoons.

This program is educational and intended to inform children 16 years of age and under. The series is designed to educate children in a variety of different subjects such as science, geography, environmental conservation and proper behavior.

This program is educational and intended to inform children 16 years of age and under. The series is designed to instruct children in a variety of different subjects, such as proper behavior, lessons in their ethnic heritage, and the importance of developing good habits.

TV Kindergarten: This series is targeted to 4-6 years olds in the nearly 75,000 Korean American household in Southern California. "TV Kindergarten" combines live action with colorful animation and music to provide education and instruction in such subjects as addition and subtraction, the changing weather seasons and why they occur, the safest way to cross the street, and the advantages of exercising. Koren youngsters are featured demonstrating many of these tasks and singing specially composed songs that help explain the subjects being presented.

Nursery Stories: produced in Taiwan, "Nursery Stories" targets KSCI's Chinse youth audience. The show is in Mandarin, with Chinese subtitling that also makes it accessible to Cantonese speaking and hearing imparied viewers. "Nursery Stories" teaches moral and behavioral lessons in the form of traditional Chinese tales and fables produced as colorful costume dramas.

"ANIMATED CLASSICS" - shows one book of treasured children's story and brings it to life through animation. Children delight in the storytelling adventures of these high quality stories that are well known to parents and appeal to the whole family. Children are encouraged to read other fantastic stories.

"BOOKMICE" - Three fun-loving mice, live secretly behind the walls of the neighborhood library. Humor, wonder, stories, music and delightful animation are present in the everyday adventures of the mice, as they explore the wondrous world of books and the library's many friends and activities. Along with encouraging love of reading, these programs promote social values, as children learn about helping others, the importance of honesty and overcoming fears.

"NEW ZOO REVUE" - This show brings an understanding of the good and bad in life to children by teaching a way of life through music. The show has three costumed characters and features two human stars who guide children through situations they will encounter day to day with the use of music, song and dance.

"ELECTRIC PLAYGROUND" - This is an educational show that focuses on the world of computers, computer software, computer games, and the Internet. It attempts to teach children more about computers and how they are forever changing the world as we know it.

"JACK HANNA'S ANIMAL ADVENTURES" - This program explores the world of animals in their natural habitat. Jack takes his young viewers on a fascinating journey into natural habitats and zoological parks to reveal secrets of the animal kingdom.

"LA ISLA DE JORDAN" - This is a non-violent, educational series featuring an endearing cast of zany puppet characters. The series is presented with dialogue spoken in accent-neutral Spanish. The show is designed to educate monolingual Spanish speaking and bilingual Spanish speaking children. The program revolves around several characters who live and play at the Animal Trackers Zoo. By focusing on specific "real life" themes, the series strives to develop the "Emotional IQ" of children as they learn to solve problems through the experiences of the characters. In addition, children learn about animals and the environment.

"MARK'S WIRED WORLD" - The program informs and educates kids in subjects relative to computers, such as how computer animation works, and teaches them values such as responsibility by instructing them in how to care for their computer pets.

"SAVE OUR STREETS" - This series digs beneath the surface to uncover the details viewers really want including useable information about crime prevention and self-protection. The National Crime Prevention Council works in association with Save Our Streets to help present compelling character-driven stories as while examining the problems of crime in America.

"CLICK" - This is a teen oriented educational game show. It teaches teens the importance of team work and incorporates questions from the world of entertainment and sports, as well as questions in math, science, literature, history, and current events.
"CENTER STREET" - This program is hosted by teenagers and focuses on teaching teens how to successfully deal with the issues and pressures surrounding our teenagers in the world.

"PEER PRESSURE" - This is a game show which incorporates social and cultural issues facing today's teens and teaches them how to make the right decisions. The program provides teens a better understanding of the factors that influence the choices that they make and helps them make educated choices that will further their social and emotional development.

"JUST IMAGINE" - Each episode is designed to reveal to children the world around them and to help kids answer the question, "What do you want to be when you grow up ?" The show invites children to dream about their future while reinforcing responsibility and discipline.

JUST THE FACTS educates and informs children between the ages of 10-16 by teaching critical thinking and problem solving skills based on Bible principles to help adolescents deal with issues that affect them.

SUPERBOOK educates and inform children between the ages of 5-10 by teaching Bible stories that highlight the important character traits chldren will need in life such as courage, loyalty, friendship and responsibility.
QUIGLEY'S VIILAGE EDUCATES AND INFORMS CHILDREN BETWEEN THE AGES 2-7 BY TEACHING IMPORTANT LIFESKILLS BASED ON POSITIVE AND PRATICAL PRINCIPLES.
GOSPEL BILL educates and informs children between the ages of 5-12 by teaching positive social skills and self awareness based on Biblical principles.
KIDS LIKE YOU educates and informs children between the ages of 6-12 by presenting challenging situations with solutions that develop character.
COLBY'S CLUBHOUSE educates and informs children the ages of 6-12 about how to successfully deal with everyday situations and challenges using the principles of the Bible.
THE KID'S CLUB educates and informs children between the ages of 3-9 about history through the Bible as well as teaching children about safety and offering exercise instruction.
FAITHVILLE educates and informs cildren between the ages of 4-16 about the value of team work and the importance of the individual within the community.

The Key educational objective of the program is to create an awareness and understanding of the enivornment and dangers of pollution. The program also seeks to teach children how to work together to solve problems.

"Channel Umptee-3" is designed to help children learn about science, technology, mathematics, psychology, history, music, literature, and art and to use critical thinking in analyzing the information provided. Dramatic situations, humor and vocabulary are used to make the program enjoyable for children in the target group.

The programs focus on dealing with the challenges of growing up. As children experience the various scenarios that Bobby finds himself in, they learn about family, friends, and values. The stories offer children, particularly the 4-11 year old audience, an opportunity to learn how to cope and understand some of the complexities of the world.

As Louie shares the tales of his childhood years, children can relate to the trials and tribulations of childhood joys and fears. 6 to 11 year olds can particularily share in Louie's experiences growing up, as the stories explore issues and scenarios that are common to growing up, yet might be perplexing to a child. The series offers children a chance to consider what they might do if faced with the same kinds of problems that Louie copes with.

This show focuses on the adventures of a young boy in an urban setting. The multicultural cast includes Jamal's sidekick C-Bear, a stuffed bear with special powers used to illustrate various moral lessons appropriate for an audience of 4-11 year olds. Each episode contributes to the educational, psychosocial, and intellectual development of children by incorporating short vignettes that encourage positive family and peer relationships as well as sound moral development.

As Louie shares the tales of his childhood years, children can relate to the trials and tribulations of childhood joys and fears. 6 to 11 year olds can particularily share in Louie's experiences growing up, as the stories explore issues and scenarios that are common to growing up, yet might be perplexing to a child. The series offers children a chance to consider what they might do if faced with the same kinds of problems that Louie copes with.

column7: SAVED BY THE BELL- THE NEW CLASS I
column16: "Saved By The Bell-The New Class" explores social themes through the daily school life of six teenage friends at Bayside High who help each other make the most of growing up in a complicated world. The Bayside kids give teens a useful perspective on many of the tough issues they have to face both in and out of the classroom. Through relatable storylines, this multi-ethnic cast serves as role models as they explore such issues as dealing with the death of a loved one, the right to say "no", the meaning of heroism, and teenage alcohol use. Add that to the normal stresses of sustaining friendships, performing well in school, and developing an identity, and the scene at Bayside High is packed with more than the usual challenges of high school life.

column7: SAVED BY THE BELL- THE NEW CLASS II
column16: "Saved By The Bell-The New Class" explores social themes through the daily school life of six teenage friends at Bayside High who help each other make the most of growing up in a complicated world. The Bayside kids give teens a useful perspective on many of the tough issues they have to face both in and out of the classroom. Through relatable storylines, this multi-ethnic cast serves as role models as they explore such issues as dealing with the death of a loved one, the right to say "no", the meaning of heroism, and teenage alcohol use. Add that to the normal stresses of sustaining friendships, performing well in school, and developing an identity, and the scene at Bayside High is packed with more than the usual challenges of high school life.

"Hang Time" follows the Deering Tornados, a boy's basketball team in an Indiana High School that is dealing with the issue of welcoming and integrating a female player into the social and interpersonal fabric of the team. The series follows the starting line-up through its basketball seasons and explores both personal themes of adolescent life, as well as the social themes which relate to sportsmanship, fair play, jealousy, teamwork, cooperation and competition. As the team progresses through each season, the audience will see them develop skills in several areas. These include establishing priorities, managing conflict, developing self-confidence, respecting differences, and reducing bias in behavior towards others. There is an emphasis on interpersonal competence and teamwork which demonstrates to the audience ways to develop positive self-concepts yet also make and maintain effective social relationships.

The series follows the starting line-up through its basketball seasons and explores both personal themes of adolescent life, as well as the social themes which relate to sportsmanship, fair play, jealousy, teamwork, cooperation and competition. As the team progresses through each season, the audience will see them develop skills in several areas. These include establishing priorities, managing conflict, developing self-confidence, respecting differences, and reducing bias in behavior towards others. There is an emphasis on interpersonal competence and teamwork which demonstrates to the audience ways to develop positive self-concepts yet also make and maintain effective social relationships.

Also included in the TNBC lineup is "NBA Inside Stuff," a half hour news magazine program directed at teens between the ages of 13-16. The program features the pro-social off-court activities of male and female basketball players, coaches, team personnel and teenage athletes. An expert educational consultant works with the producers and writers of the show to make sure that the program segments are based on a curriculum inspired by the U.S. Department of Education's Goals 2000, with particular focus on messages encouraging the following values - school completion, community service, cooperation, tolerance of differences, healthful practices and athletics, peaceful conflict resolution and global awareness. These educational and informational messages are conveyed primarily through real life examples, interviews and commentary by the program's host. Weekly features on players and other individuals help the audience see how these individuls were able to overcome various obstacles in order to achieve their goals.

The educational objective of this program is to demonstrate how the knowledge of one or more characters in the story moves from one level to a more informed or higher level of knowledge by the end of each episode. This change in knowledge conveys an educational message to the audience which may fall into one or more categories - intellectual-cognitive and/or social-emotional. The message will always be integral to the plot and present throughout the script. This objective is achieved in this series by exploring the pressures of living in a big city environment where situations are sometimes so difficult and challenging, kids have to learn sophisticated and responsible decision-making to be safe and stay focused. The series follows the encounters and problem-solving of two young men through an eventful school year at Manhattan High and shows teens how to work with their principal, family and friends to be successful.
this live action program is designed to meet the educational and informational need of children.

This educational/informational program targets children under 12 yrs. of age. Arcandina delivers an important message on what is harmful to the environment and offers solutions on how to preserve it.

Lift-Off is designed to educate and enrich the imagination of children by means of history and amusing characters, they discover that they are capable to confront certain situations and resolve their own problems.

"KOLITAS" - Interaction among children and mascot through various games and songs. Each program has segments discussing various subjects. Topics discussed are rules of tennis, the environment, importance of education and friendship, how to build a telephone, etc.

Chiquitran is based on the concept of teaching through entertainment. The program deals with a specific topic - such as recycling, or a culture as the Aztecs. Chiquitran also includes visits to the museum or zoo, reading and a children's newscast, with interviews and artists, sports figures, etc. Chiquitran is a result of KWHY's commitment of L.A.'s hispanic children. This program airs free from commercial interruption.

"BOOKMICE" - Three fun-loving mice, live secretly behind the walls of the neighborhood library. Humor, wonder, stories, music and delightful animation are present in the everyday adventures of the mice, as they explore the wondrous world of books and the library's many friends and activities. Along with encouraging love of reading, these programs promote social values, as children learn about helping others, the importance of honesty and overcoming fears.

"WORSHIP FOR KIDS" - This program is devoted to giving kids the opportunity to learn and to worship God. The show uses Biblical readings to illustrate a moral teaching and challenges children to apply Christian values to everyday life situations.

"JUST KIDS" - This is a program designed to inform children in both educational and spiritual matters through the use of informative and interesting segments. A cast of regular characters share insight that will help children grow in practical ways.

"BECKY'S BARN" - This is a program that teaches children both educational and morality lessons through a cast of real life puppet characters whose lives revolve around a farm specifically Becky's Barn. Each episode combines spiritual and educational concepts along with health and safety tips.

"SUNSHINE FACTORY" - A show devoted to teaching children how to morally resolve problems and deal with emotional issues. The show centers around the owners of a fixit shop and some of the people who live in the neighborhood. Each week, a specific issue is raised at the shop and the characters take a special trip to the Sunshine Factory to learn how to positively deal with the issue.

"SONSHINY DAY" - This program teaches children about moral values and practical Christian living through scripture memorization, puppets, singing and funfilled activities. The goal is to help children learn how to deal with relationships, their questions about God, morality lessons and to bring hope to the children.

"JOY JUNCTION" - This is a program designed to be an interactive learning experience. Set in a Western town, Joy Junction features a cast of characters and a studio audience. Kids in the audience participate in a game show format while the show's characters play out a story that teaches kids a pro-social message and morality lesson in a way that has a long lasting impact.
